title: Are Stavros Flatley splitting up after the BGT: The Champions final?
text:
Stavros Flatley have set the rumour mill churning about their future (Picture: ITV)

Stavros Flatley are set to make their return to the Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions stage on Saturday night after making it through to the final of the series.

The much-beloved father son duo won themselves Simon Cowell’s Golden Buzzer when they appeared earlier in the series, nabbing themselves an automatic place in the final as they whipped the crowds at Wembley into a frenzy.

However their performance on Saturday night’s show comes amid rumours that this could be the last time they’ll perform together – with reports suggesting they’re splitting up.

Say it ain’t so? What’s going on? Here’s what you need to know…

Are Stavros Flatley splitting up?

OK, let’s all calm down folks – because despite the rumours Stavros Flatley have denied they are splitting up.

The pair quelled the rumours on Instagram ahead of Saturday’s final, with a video in which they slammed any sign of a break-up – with main man Demi locking himself in the toilet and asking son Lagi whether or not they had split.

‘We’re not splitting up man,’ he insisted – as his dad shouted back: ‘I’m staying in here until you tell me for sure we haven’t split up.’

As Demi asked him: ‘Are you sure?’ he replied: ‘Yes dad, I have to see you later when I go home.’

Demi added: ‘Yeah I know but, what if we’ve split up and we don’t know?’ to which Lagi told him: ‘Course we know, we haven’t split up, would you just come out?’

All of which led to celebration for Demi as he emerged from the bathroom and cheered ‘Yay!’, before he fled the building and raced off down the street shouting ‘We haven’t split up!’ repeatedly.

Yay indeed.

Why were Stavros Flatley rumoured to be splitting?

The rumours began after Lagi told The Sun that he was stepping aside to focus on his barbershop in Cyprus, and would be replaced by Demi’s nephew Sampson.

‘We’ve done so many things but what is there left to do? We’ve done the Royal Variety, we’ve played in China, Monaco – everywhere,’ he said.

‘So when we got to The Champions, I thought this was the right time to leave. But Simon Cowell told me not to quit forever. So I will return for some shows.’

The pair first appeared on Britain’s Got Talent in 2009 when Lagi was 12 years old – going on to finish fourth in the year that also gave the world Susan Boyle and Diversity.
